metadata.title: CVE-2023-51779 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
bt_sock_recvmsg in net/bluetooth/af_bluetooth.c in the Linux kernel through6.6.8 has a use-after-free because of a bt_sock_ioctl race condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-51779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-100-generic - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-5.15.0-100-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-100-generic - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-100-generic-64k - 5.15.0-100.110
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1058-azure - 5.15.0-1058.66
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1058-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1058.66.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1053-gcp - 5.15.0-1053.61
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1052-gke - 5.15.0-1052.57
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1038-gkeop - 5.15.0-1038.44
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1048-ibm - 5.15.0-1048.51
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-100-lowlatency - 5.15.0-100.110
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-100-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-100.110
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1046-nvidia - 5.15.0-1046.46

No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1048-raspi - 5.15.0-1048.51
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-100.110').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
linux-hwe-6.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.5, was needs-triage').
